name: Paul Sauer 2005
description:
*‘The 2005 Paul Sauer offers an exuberant bouquet with dried prune, licorice, a touch of caramel and fig that just soars from the glass. The palate is medium-bodied with a harmonious, focused opening. The tannins lend the 2005 a firm structure, but there is plenty of fruit to back it up and the finish fans out with luscious licorice, sea salt and black fruits that linger. Superb. Drink 2014-2025.’* - Neal Martin, Wine Advocate, 93/100 (2013)


*‘Confident, refined 05, 70% Cabernet Sauvignon with equal Merlot and Cabernet Franc spent 2 years in new casks after traditional fermentation in open kuipe. Seductive cedar, spice and richly layered fruit will appeal to eager audience, as will plush, lengthy finish. 14.5% alc. ’* - Platter’s SA Wine Guide, 4.5☆ (2009)

 The wines will be cellared at Wine Cellar (Professional wine storage, Cape Town) vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal.
